resources.string: You can always revisit the tutorial from the navigation drawer!
On Android 4.4, PXL uses compatible dark theme
Palette name is already in use or incorrect!\n(You may use only letters, digits and spaces)
Click on the color in palette you want to replace with current color!
Click on a color to edit it!
Width and height must be bigger than 0
Maximum size of imported image is %dx%d!
Enter desired pixel size of greater side of the image, size of the lesser side will be calculated using aspect ratio of the project
Unable to access gallery. Please give PXL permission to access files on the device.

Original resolution will look blurry in most apps, but is suitable for further editing as a pixel art.\n\nOn the other hand, resolution suggested for posting/sharing the art will look good in other apps, but it will be unsuitable for further editing as a pixel art
Maximum project resolution is %dx%d.\n\nDo you want PXL to resize imported image to %dx%d?

Do you want to posterize this image?\n\n(Posterization means reducing the color palette of the image to 16 colors, so it looks more \"pixelartish\". Usually looks good on art, but somewhat odd on photos, you can experiment though)
Both width and height must be greater than 0
Tip: You can drag the image or use the buttons to move it pixel-by-pixel
The background color of a transparent canvas, so you can see the actual drawing area.\nVanishes when you export the project
Improves performance of some tools drastically

Only disable hardware acceleration, if "Accelerated Tools", listed below, make app crash or don't work

Accelerated Tools:
Color Swapper

Tools that aren't available without hardware acceleration:
Posterization on Import
Enable support of up to 512x512 projects and images.\nNot recommended on devices with less than 2GBs of RAM until you have \"Huge history\" enabled
This will override all of the modified colors in default palettes and restore deleted ones
Automatically switches to the previous tool after picking color with Color Picker tool
Color Swapper tool instantly swaps the picked color to the current paint color instead of opening a color chooser with an ability to live-preview changes
Uses pixel perfect but a slightly more resources-demanding symmetry
Keeps up to 1024 elements in history
Just a pencil. Use tool settings panel to change the stroke width and line caps style
Works just like the pencil, but erases the color, hence changing it to white or transparent, if you enabled transparent background in project creation window
One tool, many shapes. Use tool settings panel to select the shape, stroke width and to configure shape-specific parameters like to lock ellipsis to circle or round rect\'s borders
A normal flood fill. Use it to fill limited areas of the same color. If you need to change all pixels of the same color on the image, use the color swapper, it works much faster
Sets the current color to the color you selected with it

Swaps all the pixels of the selected color on the image to another color. It will open a live preview window on use, where you can alter the selected color in real time.

Warning:
This will work super-slow on large pictures if you have disabled the hardware acceleration in settings

Drag from one point to another to create a selection rect.

To move selected pixels, tap inside the selection rect and drag it.

You can use the "Clone" button on the left to create a clone of selection under it and the "Clear" button to delete the selected pixels.

To remove the selection, tap outside the selection rect.
In case you want to read it again

In cursor mode use your finger to move the cursor on screen and press the "Draw" button at the bottom to draw at the cursor position.

• Drag your finger anywhere on screen to move the cursor.

• You can move cursor and press the "Draw" button at the same time.

You can pick color from a palette or select an arbitrary custom color.\n\n• You can override a color in a palette with currently selected one by long-clicking the color in palette you want to override.
